body.p: In reconsidering the scope, the Board noted that the use of the term ‘non‑current’ caused the following problems:

li.p: assets that are acquired with the intention of resale were clearly intended to be within the scope of ED 4, but would also be within the definition of current assets and so might be thought to be excluded. The same was true for assets that had been classified as non‑current but were now expected to be realised within twelve months.
it was not clear how the scope would apply to assets presented in accordance with a liquidity presentation.
